text:
Hello All,
I am working to add am HTML/Hubl module to my emails. The module is created and working fine, but the problem is the HTML coded section renders as if it is not within the same template. (When i test the email, this section appears out of the email template dimensions, as if it is not inside the email frame)
I am used to code emails using tables approach. Is there a specific way to code this for it to be treated as an embedded section in my email body ? It is a multiple column html section.
Hi <@U7SL518D6> would you know if `?hsNoJQuery=true` should still work? I tried on our domain and the static jQuery 1.11 is still being added
can you link to the site you’re testing against?
I’d prefer the normal tickets but it seems that has moved here to the public forum
Our settings have 1.11 selected, and that still shows in the page source when adding the url param
I am seeing `<script src="/hs/hsstatic/jquery-libs/static-1.4/jquery/jquery-1.11.2.js"></script>` added in the head but I can’t test other replacement options while this is active

Noting in-case anyone comes here - we took the conversation to the DMs and found a solution. If you’re experiencing this issue, add the `&hsDebug=true` to the end of your URL. I’ve reported the issue internally. Hopefully we can make it so you don’t need hs debug.
